channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrats should have celebrated America’s stunning economic success–but they were intimidated by progressives
item.description: The elitist Biden and Harris advisors bought into the false Trump economic narrative rather than confidently and clearly explain the actual economic f...

item.title: Working out at these times of day could reduce your risk of colorectal cancer by 11%, new study says
item.description: Study participants who were continuously physically active during the day also showed a lower risk of developing colorectal cancer.

item.title: What to know about Susie Wiles, the Trump operative who will be the first woman to serve as White House chief of staff
item.description: The first woman to serve as White House chief of staff has a 40-year career in GOP politics.

item.title: The Trump Era Never Really Ended
item.description: Should we even call it a comeback?

item.title: Jamie Oliver Pulls Children’s Book Amid Criticism of Insensitivity
item.description: The celebrity chef’s second children’s book, “Billy and the Epic Escape,” faced accusations that it stereotyped First Nations people in Australia.

item.title: Hama Amadou, West African Political ‘Phoenix,’ Dies at 74
item.description: An embattled leader for decades in Niger’s rough-and-tumble politics, he alternated stints in high office with prison and exile.

item.title: Iran and Trump Are Front of Mind at Saudi Summit
item.description: Leaders from across the Arab and Muslim world were in Riyadh for a meeting officially convened to discuss the fighting in Gaza and Lebanon.

item.title: Jamie Oliver Pulls Children’s Book Amid Criticism of Insensitivity
item.description: The celebrity chef’s second children’s book, “Billy and the Epic Escape,” faced accusations that it stereotyped First Nations people in Australia.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Sets Another Record as Post-Election Rally Continues
item.description: The cryptocurrency hit $82,000 as a rally that began after President-elect Donald J. Trump’s election gained steam.

item.title: Israel’s Military Announces Small Expansion of Gaza Humanitarian Zone
item.description: The move comes just before a Biden administration deadline for Israel to deliver more aid to the enclave or risk a cutoff of military supplies.

item.title: Here’s how HR leaders can help employees prepare and recover from a hurricane
item.description: With climate change on the rise, employers need to implement policies and measures to provide for workers in their time of need.

item.title: Uranus Might Have Experienced a Freak Event When Voyager 2 Visited
item.description: Much of the understanding of the seventh planet comes from a brief flyby nearly 40 years ago, which researchers now say overlapped with an exceptional...

item.title: Cuba Shaken by 6.8 Magnitude Earthquake: Maps
item.description: View the location of the epicenters and shake areas.

item.title: Iran and Trump Are Front of Mind at Saudi Summit
item.description: Leaders from across the Arab and Muslim world were in Riyadh for a meeting officially convened to discuss the fighting in Gaza and Lebanon.

item.title: America solved veterans’ unemployment within a decade—but ‘underemployment’ continues to hold back their talents
item.description: With national unemployment rates at historically low levels, veteran unemployment is now even lower, dropping to 2.8% last month.
